page.title: 14Chelmsley W. Police Station
page.content: In May 1971 the police occupied their new Chelmsley Wood station. 84 officers are men and 19 are women. 75% of the force are uniformed. Eight dogs are available,two of which are sniffer dogs used to detect explosives and drugs. No horses are kept. Cars used include 10 Metro's, coloured white or panda; 2 Maestro's for high speed work,and a small Ford transit van for carrying personnel.There are some lightweight motor cycles.The station serves the areas of Chelmsly Wood, Castle Bromwich, Marston Green and Kingshurst. Two main types of crime dealt with are 1.Theft of all kinds e.g. from cars, houses, washing lines and of bicycles. 2.Criminal damage of property. In 1984 4,000 crimes were committed. Chelmsley Wood police solved 38%, a detection rate claimed to be higher than average.
